intro: Clypeola minor, commonly known as the small clypeola, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, typically found in grassy or rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, contributing to its use in traditional herbal medicine. Clypeola minor is often cultivated for its ornamental value and mild fragrance.
